info.title: Direct Debit Mandate
info.description:
An authorization given by a debtor to a creditor to initiate instructions to debit funds owed to the creditor from a specified account, and the authorization to the debtor bank to comply with the instructions issued by the creditor.
You can use this API to create new direct debit mandates or to query existing direct debit mandates.

Remark:
The service Direct Debit Mandate is assigned to service group Transactional Banking.

General:
The properties of the EDM that are based on a code GDT do not contain supplementary components (e.g. listID) that are known from the GDTs of the enterprise services.

x-sap-shortText: Create new direct debit mandates or query existing direct debit mandates using this synchronous inbound service

get.description: Is a request to query direct debit mandates

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionfilter)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect)

post.description: Is a request to create a direct debit mandate

parameters.name: UUID
parameters.description:
Is a universal unique identifier of a direct debit mandate.  
GDT: UUID

get.summary: Read Direct Debit Mandate by UUID
get.description: Is a request to read a direct debit mandate

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionselect)

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_BatchRequests).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET DirectDebitMandates HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

ID.title: An identifier for an item of a Direct Debit Mandate Amendment History.
ID.description:
Remark: The ID is only unique in context of the direct debit mandate.  
GDT: DirectDebitMandateAmendmentHistoryItemID

com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.title: Amendment History Item
com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.description: An item that captures the history of amendments for a direct debit mandate. A Direct Debit Mandate can be revised any number of times. If a revision is amendment relevant, the previous values of the Direct Debit Mandate is captured as Direct Debit Mandate Amendment History Item. The SEPA Rulebook by the European Payment Council defines what revisions are amendment relevant. In course of time, direct debit mandates are amended for various reasons.

com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.title: Amendment History Item (for create)
com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.description: An item that captures the history of amendments for a direct debit mandate. A Direct Debit Mandate can be revised any number of times. If a revision is amendment relevant, the previous values of the Direct Debit Mandate is captured as Direct Debit Mandate Amendment History Item. The SEPA Rulebook by the European Payment Council defines what revisions are amendment relevant. In course of time, direct debit mandates are amended for various reasons.

com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.title: Amendment History Item (for update)
com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.description: An item that captures the history of amendments for a direct debit mandate. A Direct Debit Mandate can be revised any number of times. If a revision is amendment relevant, the previous values of the Direct Debit Mandate is captured as Direct Debit Mandate Amendment History Item. The SEPA Rulebook by the European Payment Council defines what revisions are amendment relevant. In course of time, direct debit mandates are amended for various reasons.

UUID.title: Is a universal unique identifier of a direct debit mandate.

ID.title: A identifier of Direct Debit Mandate.
ID.description:
Remark: The CreditorPartyID (according AT-02 of the SEPA rulebooks) and the DirectDebitMandateID are the semantic key of a direct debit mandate. A DirectDebitMandateID is only unique in context of a CreditorPartyID.
GDT: DirectDebitMandateID

CreditorPartyID.title: A unique identifier of a creditor party of direct debit mandate.
CreditorPartyID.description:
Remark: Contains the Creditor Identification according AT-02 of the SEPA rulebooks. 
Integrity Conditions: - The CreditorPartyID has to be equal to the CreditorParty-->ID. 
Constraint: Only 35 characters maximum are allowed. 
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
GDT: PartyID

ChangeStateID.title: Identifies a change state.
ChangeStateID.description:
Remark:  1) Property is required for subsequent usage of corresponding SOAP update service. 2) Property is used as ETag. 
GDT: ChangeStateID

UserStatusCode.title: A coded representation of the user status of a direct debit mandate.
UserStatusCode.description:
Constraint: Only the code values 2 - Active, 3 - To be confirmed, 4 - Locked 5 - Canceled, 6 - Discarded are allowed. 
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
BDT: DirectDebitMandateUserStatusCode

SignatureDate.title: Time Point at which a signature for direct debit mandate is given.

SignatureCityName.title: Name of the city where the signature for a direct debit mandate is given.

ValidityPeriod.title: Period for which the direct debit mandate is valid.

DirectDebitSchemeCode.title: A coded representation of a direct debit scheme. A direct debit scheme is a set of rules and obligations regarding the collection of direct debit payments.
DirectDebitSchemeCode.description:
Example: SEPA Core or a SEPA B2B are examples for a scheme. 
GDT: DirectDebitSchemeCode

DirectDebitCollectionSEPASequenceTypeCod.title: A coded representation of a SEPA sequence type of a direct debit collection. A SEPA sequence type specifies a type of direct debit collection for which the direct debit mandate is issued.
DirectDebitCollectionSEPASequenceTypeCod.description:
The SEPA sequence type for a direct debit collection is defined in the European Payments Council's "SEPA CORE DIRECT DEBIT SCHEME CUSTOMER-TO-BANK IMPLEMENTATION GUIDELINES" and follows the ISO 20022 standard for "Universal financial industry message schemes".
Constraint: Only the code values 'OOFF' - One-Off and 'RCUR' - Recurring are allowed. 
GDT: DirectDebitCollectionSEPASequenceTypeCode

BusinessProcessChainAssignment.title: The assignment of a direct debit mandate to a business process chain.
BusinessProcessChainAssignment.description: BusinessProcessChain is a chain of business processes carried out in a business scenario. BOCT: BusProcChnAssgmtFSElmnts

RelatedCreditorParty.title: A party that is related with the creditor party.
RelatedCreditorParty.description: Remark: The creditor party of a direct debit mandate in S/4 TRBK can either be related to an operational bank contract management unit that represents the bank or can be related to a business partner (account holder) of the bank. If the creditor party is related to a business partner the bank manages direct debits mandates for the business partner (for example for a club). When a direct debit mandate is created data from related creditor party can be copied to the creditor party of the direct debit mandate.

CreditorParty.title: Creditor party of the direct debit mandate.
CreditorParty.description:
Integrity Condition: Name and ID (CI) have to be specified. 
Constraints: - for CreditorParty-->ID: Only 35 characters maximum are allowed.

OriginalCreditorParty.title: Creditor party for whom the direct debit mandate is originally given.The CreditorParty acts on behalf of OriginalCreditorParty.
OriginalCreditorParty.description:
Constraint: OriginalCreditorParty-->ID: Only 35 characters maximum are allowed. 
Remark: The CI will be transmitted in OriginalCreditorParty-->ID.

RelatedDebtorPartyID.title: A party that is related with the debtor party.
RelatedDebtorPartyID.description:
Remark: When a direct debit mandate is created data from related debtor party can be copied to the debtor party of the direct debit mandate. 
Use: Direct debit mandates can be searched by the ID of the RelatedDebtorParty. 
Integrity Constraint: RelatedDebtorPartyID can only be specified, if RelatedCreditorParty is an operational bank contract management unit that represents the bank. 
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator.

DebtorParty.title: Debtor party of the direct debit mandate.

FinalDebtorParty.title: Debtor party of the direct debit mandate that is finally debited.
FinalDebtorParty.description: Remark: The DebtorParty acts on behalf of FinalDebtorParty.

CreditorReferenceID.title: An identifier for a direct debit mandate creditor reference
CreditorReferenceID.description:
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
GDT: DirectDebitMandateCreditorReferenceID

CreditorReferenceDescription.title: A description for a direct debit mandate creditor reference.

BusinessTransactionDocumentReferenceID.title: Unique identifier for the referenced business document.
BusinessTransactionDocumentReferenceID.description:
Remark: Contains the ID of the Payment Transaction Order (which is a concatenation of value for payment transaction area and payment order ID). 
GDT: BusinessTransactionDocumentID

BusinessTransactionDocumentReferenceType.title: Coded representation of the type of business document that is referenced.
BusinessTransactionDocumentReferenceType.description:
Remark: TypeCode has always value 1182 (Bank Account Contract Payment Transaction Order Request). 
GDT: BusinessTransactionDocumentTypeCode

UtilisationDate.title: Date when a direct debit mandate is utilized.

BankingBusinessTransactionTypeCode.title: BankingBusinessTransactionTypeCode is the coded representation of the banking business transaction which is associated with the business process chain to which the hosting buisiness object is assigned to.
BankingBusinessTransactionTypeCode.description: Default: If BankingBusinessTransactionTypeCode is not provided the code "500010 Maintaining a direct debit mandate" is set. GDT: BankingBusinessTransactionTypeCode

BankRelatedCreditorPartyIndicator.title: Indicates whether the related creditor party of the direct debit mandate is the bank itself.
BankRelatedCreditorPartyIndicator.description:
Integrity Condition: If BankRelatedCreditorPartyIndicator is true OperationalBankContractManagementUnitID has to to be specified. If BankRelatedCreditorPartyIndicator is false ID has to to be specified. 
Remark: If BankRelatedCreditorPartyIndicator is true, OperationalBankContractManagementUnit is derived from the CreditorPartyID by the system. If BankRelatedCreditorPartyIndicator is false ID has to be specified. 
GDT: Indicator

ID.title: An identifier for a party.
ID.description:
Remark: PartyTypeCode is value 147 "Business Partner". Corresponds to PersonIdentificationPartyID in ISO20022. 
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
GDT: PartyID

OperationalBankContractManagementUnitID.title: An OperationalBankContractManagementID is a unique identifier of an organizational unit that is responsible for managing operational bank contracts and executing the related banking processes.
OperationalBankContractManagementUnitID.description:
Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
GDT: OrganisationalCentreID

com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.title: Related Creditor Party
com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.description: A party that is related with the creditor party.

StartDate.title: The start date of the validity period.

EndDate.title: The end date of the validity period.

com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.title: Validity Period
com.sap.gateway.default.directdebitmanda.description:
CLOSED_UNBOUNDED_DatePeriod is a period that is defined by two points in time. These points in time are expressed in calendar days. CLOSED_UNBOUNDED_DatePeriod includes the start and the end time-point. The start/end time-point may be unbounded (infinite).Integrity Condition: EndDate must be greater than or equal to the StartDate. 
Remark: In Case the EndDate and the StartDate are equal, the duration of the period is 1 Day, due to the fact that the end time-point is included. An unbounded (infinite) time-point is expressed by omitting the element.

count.description: The number of entities in the collection. Available when using the [$count](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptioncount) query option.

innererror.description: The structure of this object is service-specific

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items, see [Paging - Top](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptiontop)

skip.name: $skip
skip.description: Skip the first n items, see [Paging - Skip](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionskip)

search.name: $search
search.description: Search items by search phrases, see [Searching](http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionsearch)
